summary: This document is an email chain from February 13, 2020, regarding media inquiries about Barclays CEO Jes Staley's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI's New York office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) coordinate not to comment on whether Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI investigation, following news that UK regulators were investigating Staley's representations about his Epstein ties.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Subject of media inquiry and UK financial regulator investigation regarding how he represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer and the regulator.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the inquiry concerns Jes Staley's social and professional relationship with him.

persons.name: Alys Key
persons.context: Journalist from London's i newspaper who initiated the email inquiry to the FBI's National Press Office, asking if Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI investigation.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.context: FBI employee in New York who forwarded the journalist's inquiry internally, noting it as 'news of the day'.

connections.description: The document references a dispute over Staley having 'some form of social relationship with Mr Epstein, as well as a professional one'.
Key is a journalist investigating and inquiring about Staley's potential cooperation with the FBI Epstein investigation.

events.title: UK Financial Regulator Inquiry into Jes Staley
events.description: News emerges that the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) is looking into how Barclays CEO Jes Staley represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein to his employer and the board relayed that to the regulator.

events.title: Media Inquiry to FBI about Staley
events.description: Journalist Alys Key contacts the FBI's National Press Office to inquire whether Jes Staley has been asked to cooperate with the FBI's Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

locations: Northcliffe House, 2 Derry Street, London W8 5TT (JPIMedia office)
keyFacts: In February 2020, the UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) was investigating Barclays CEO Jes Staley regarding how he represented his relationship with Jeffrey Epstein.
The core dispute involved Staley having both a social and a professional relationship with Epstein.
The FBI's New York office and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) coordinated not to comment on the media inquiry about Staley's potential cooperation.

The email chain shows internal FBI coordination (involving a Public Affairs Specialist and an Acting Assistant Special Agent in Charge) in handling sensitive media inquiries related to the Epstein investigation.
